sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you want to <radical>say</radical> how <radical>eternity</radical> sounds you have to <kanji>compose</kanji> a poem. Or an essay. Or a song. <kanji>Recite</kanji> those deep thoughts about eternity and impress everyone who hears it.
meaningInfo: Try to compose a poem about eternity right now. Just jot it down somewhere.
readingMnemonic: You decide to <kanji>compose</kanji> a poem about an <reading>a</reading>corn (<ja>えい</ja>). The tiny acorn is the perfect vessel for you to say how eternity feels to you.
readingInfo:
Let me recite the acorn poem to you now:

Acorns start small
Grow up big and tall
Spread their baby acorns for all
Live on for all eternity
